lead_paragraph: With Mr. Trump declaring he will skip Thursday’s debate, the most potentially consequential fight is no longer between him and his fellow Republican candidates.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin, Nick Corasaniti and Matt Flegenheimer contributed reporting.
byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG, MAGGIE HABERMAN and JOHN KOBLIN

headline.print_headline: With No Détente, Trump’s Feud With Fox Moves to Center Stage
headline.main: With No Détente, Donald Trump’s Feud With Fox Takes Center Stage

snippet: With Mr. Trump declaring he will skip Thursday’s debate, the most potentially consequential fight is no longer between him and his fellow Republican candidates.
abstract: Donald J Trump's decision to skip Republican presidential debate hosted by Fox News in advance of Iowa caucus, over objections to presence of anchor Megyn Kelly, shifts focus of presidential contest to Trump's feud with network, rather than on candidates; both network and campaign have had intense internal conversations about ongoing hostility, yet neither side seems willing to budge; Trump attributes his final decision to mocking press release issued by network.
